instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 00165 no display
threads.message:
history:
no power due to liquid spill damage ( milk )
smc replaced, worked for three months

now, the unit has no display, no chime, caps lock does not turn on so I guess its not backlight issue
ssd works on other units
holding alt key does not show boot options

<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PHASE1</SIGNAL> & 2 = 1.697v


tried reflashing bios but the same issue

please help on where to check next

thank you in advance
stay safe guys

threads.title: 820 00165 no display
threads.message:
Corrosion in other part of the board.
Didn't properly eliminate first time, and some component (maybe resistor) got damaged in time.
Can also be a broken trace.

Sometime leakage can appear between GPU balls.
Heat CPU with quality flux.
No need to melt the balls, just to burn eventually accumulated crap.
